data.question: What is the chemical formula for CD-MOF-1?
What method was used to collect data for CD-MOF-1?
data.answer: Bruker d8-APEX II CCD diffractometer with graphite-monochromated Cu-Kα radiation

data.question: How were the crystals of CD-MOF-1 prepared?
data.answer: By dissolving γ-CD and KOH in H2O, filtering the solution, and allowing slow vapor diffusion of MeOH into the solution.

data.question: What was the yield percentage of CD-MOF-1 crystals obtained from the synthesis process?
Is CD-MOF-1 thermally stable up to 200 °C under oxidative conditions?
Can CD-MOF-1 absorb gases and small organic molecules?
What was the method used to activate CD-MOF-1 and CD-MOF-2 for gas adsorption experiments?
data.answer: By immersing in CH2Cl2 for three days, followed by vacuum drying.

data.question: What was the purpose of washing CD-MOF-2 crystals with CH2Cl2 during the small molecule absorption experiment?
data.answer: To remove excess of 4-phenylazophenol and ensure no excess remained outside the crystals.

data.question: Did the elemental analysis data for CD-MOF-1 correspond to the expected solvent composition by weight percentage?
Was the cubic symmetry of the unit cell in edible CD-MOF-1 commuted due to the ordering of observed benzoate counterions?
What was the crystallographic space group of CD-MOF-2?
What was the method used to measure the presence of counterions quantitatively in CD-MOFs?
data.answer: By dissolving the crystals in D2O and analyzing by 1H NMR spectroscopy.

data.question: Is it possible to prepare CD-MOFs entirely from food-grade ingredients?
What was the crystallographic space group of edible CD-MOF-1?
Did the small molecule co-crystallization experiment with Rhodamine B confirm the ability of CD-MOF-2 to include aqueous soluble guests?
What was the crystallographic space group of CD-MOF-4?
What was the method used for thermal stability and activation of CD-MOFs?
data.answer: By soaking in CH2Cl2 for three days, followed by vacuum drying.

data.question: Was the underlying MOF structure of edible CD-MOF-1 affected by the ordering of benzoate counterions?
What was the crystallographic space group of [(SrBr2)·(γ-CD)]n?
Did the preparation of CD-MOF-3 and CD-MOF-4 from CsOH result in the formation of two distinct crystalline forms?
